title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of California (Martinez, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
1st - computerized in interview
2nd - zoom pane with two managers
60 minutes were schedule for the interview however it lasted 20 minutes.
the interview was on a Friday afternoon
They will contact me in two weeks, since they are interview folks for another week, then wk  to make a decision.
Interview Questions:
how do you communicate with clients..
tell me about an accomplishment 
how do you prioritize your wk when you have several items due at the same time.

title: Student Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty a traditional and professional interview. It included a typical in-person segement and then a driving test. The driving test was only offered to some interview applicants after the initial questionnaire portion.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where you were driving an upset passenger because you made them late to a midterm?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: very structured; received questions ahead of time; staff approachable; able to interview remotely; completed online application, received an email for HR, scheduled an interview; a panel of interviewers was available
Interview Questions: give an example of a difficult situation and how you resolved it

title: Lab Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: They will tell you about what is required for the job and ask about how you feel completing each task. If they like you, then you would begin negotiating your salary.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you feel completing "x" or "y" task?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: three ppl on the panel and most interviews with the University are panel.  I felt comfortable with the interview steps.  I started as a contract employee for a year and a half
Interview Questions: Do you have a background in account?

title: ASUCLA Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asks basic questions to get to know you better and to see if you are reliable. Because most positions on campus are for students they want to ensure that you are responsible and have good time management skills.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a customer that was upset?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: easy student online application and hiring process, contact with department directly, no interview, offer last for whole year, take application from spring quarter, for EE department require second year master or phd
Interview Questions: Auto student evaluation

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short. About 15-20 minutes long. They ask you common sense questions and some personality type questions. They usually take very extraverted people so as long as you are a people-person and can speak well, you're good to go. If you apply for cashier, they'll quickly and randomly throw you one small arithmetic question.
Interview Questions: What song describes you?

title: SASC Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: You have to prepare a session on any topic or you can choose from given topics. You are in a room with three other applicants and the person holding the session. Then, you teach about any topic for a few minutes, as if you were tutoring someone. They tell you a little "how-to" beforehand. As long as you are interactive and remember their tips, it should be easy.
Interview Questions: How would you teach a topic?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: Some interviews were interested in my skills others were interested in my personality. Overall they seemed very focused on advancing my career as well as finding a good fit for their research team.
Interview Questions: Where do I see my career in 5 years

title: Assistant Art Museum Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California (Memphis, TN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had multiple hour long conversations and tours with different members of the museum staff and campus communities over the course of a day. Interview also included a with the committee.
Interview Questions: Why Memphis?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California (Santa Monica, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Was called without warning for a phone screening interview by the supervisor for this position. We had a brief conversation with two questions, then I was asked to schedule an in-person interview. Second interview was fairly standard, though I was warned towards the end that working with the Executive Director can be very frustrating and difficult at times. I was then asked to schedule a final interview (with pre-interview Administrative test). At the final interview, I took the admin test first and was asked to leave when I missed 2-3 errors on a proofreading test with 40 or so errors total. The Executive Director would not meet with me, though I was previously told this test was a formality. A candidate with twice the experience requested was turned away because of a few missed errors on a proofreading test. Overall, an exceptionally callous and short-sighted way to treat prospective employees. My brief glimpse of the organization tells me this is likely quite a difficult and tedious environment in which to work.
Interview Questions: Asked how I would handle various problematic scenarios around event management.

title: Cooperative Extension Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California (Hanford, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: 4 steps in 4 hours (8 a.m. - noon). 1) 20 minute presentation about a program I would develop to address a need in the community 2) Formal interview 3) Tour of Facility and Meet County Directors 4) 30 minute timed writing assignment
Interview Questions: What is sustainable agriculture?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a call to schedule the interview within a week. The interview lasted approximately 20 minutes. The questions were pretty basic since it was an entry level job. The questions focused on usual things like obstacles you've faced at work, conflicts with other employees, and why you want to work at that particular place.
Interview Questions: What is one obstacle that you've faced in a previous work environment and how did you address it?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California (Santa Cruz, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to talk about my passion for food systems and it felt more like a conversation. It was nice to connect with others with similar interests. They asked me around 10 different questions in total.
Interview Questions: What type of change would you like to bring about in our current food system?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds of group interviews. Some of the interviewers were in more than one round. I got the sense they were checking to make sure my responses were consistent.
Interview Questions: If you were thrust in a project and you heard that there was someone who was difficult to work with but you knew you had to work with them, what would you do?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California (Davis, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Overly complicated, yet informal. Seems to be up to individual departments, not standardized.  You may reach out directly to principle investigators/faculty members and express your interest in their lab.
Interview Questions: I was mainly asked to contribute to developing ideas for and writing a grant proposal that would cover my salary. This will obviously be dependent on your area of expertise, and you should research the lab ahead of time and be prepared to contribute to their specific projects.

title: Accountant Affiliate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California (Riverside, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a panel, 4 individuals, one manager, lead from our department, a general accounting representative and an individual from Human Resourses in December of 2015. The second interview was conducted because our returning supervisor came back so a second interview was conducted to include the second candidate for the position. Another set of interview was conducted for several other candidates, I did suspect that my former supervisor upon her return was given specific instructions as to what candidate should be picked for the position in line with the requirements needed to fulfill the requirements of the new open position.
Interview Questions: It was a structured question and something related to inter personal relations with your co-worker or supervisor.

title: Fellowship, Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Send application directly to professors of interest.  The professor/department will recruit by inviting applicant to visit the laboratory facilities and meet others in the department.  Candidates are usually required to give a 1 hour seminar talk, describing past research, techniques.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give a 1 hour seminar talk on past research

title: PC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly informative and easy, because it felt more like a conversation for me. I asked a lot of questions and got a lot of positive feedback and a tour of the facility after the interview. The process seemed seamless and the people how interviewed me took their time in answering my questions. I recommend doing your research and knowing what you did in your last job. Experience always helps because it adds weight to your narrative.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your last job?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of California (Davis, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Having two rounds of interview and stressful. A postdoc position does not need to be that stressful. hh  hh  hh  hh  h h  h  h   hhh  h  h
Interview Questions: what have you done in your Phd?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Their was no interview process I was hired by my research advisor.  There was no interview process I was given the job and all I had to do was accept it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: SRAIII Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy, brief, and straight to the point. Talked about what was on my CV and moved on to any interests or facts about myself that the CV cannot answer. Very basic and generic and I really don't have any more words to keep filling this out
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went through three rounds of interview process. In the first round I was asked mostly basic questions about my goals and earliest joining date. In second round my technical skill set and critical thinking was tested. Third round was the onsite round where I was asked to present.
Interview Questions:
What can you bring to my lab?
How would you fit in my group?
What are some ideas that you and I can write a grant of off?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of California (Berkeley, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: group, panel interview after sending resume.  I heard about the job from a referral source who introduced us, but I did also need to file an application online.  This was a contract for a specified period, so I got a contract to sign, similar to an offer letter.
Interview Questions: Did I know how to use the software they track with.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of California (Santa Barbara, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, 2 on 1 interview, and an application essay. Interview process was mostly about demonstrating your ability to work in a group (your teamwork dynamic) and determining your social ability (ability to empathize/emotional intelligence).
Interview Questions: Name a moment you're proud of.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: You have to do a group interview as well as a two on one interview. The group interview is about how you can work with a team and whether you can step up and also step down. The two on one interview is about your experience and problem-solving skills.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone gave you the answers to a test you were stressed out about?

title: Videographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California (Davis, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with two department representatives, the manager and my (future) direct supervisor, for a standard interview. The whole process took roughly 30 minutes, covering the regular gamut of questions: name a time you were successful, name a time that you were challenged, how do you handle stress, what is your current (most recent) pay rate, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you failed.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: Department was very communicative, faculty were great to speak with, students were very helpful in sharing information about the department and courses. Students were also very responsive by email. Department was very fast in making the decision and letting you know. Visit days are well-organized.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do basic scientific research and why Berkeley?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California (Oakland, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was not be taken seriously.  Management panel rescheduled my interview date and time three times after they had already completed their final selection process.  I am still trying to understand the point to the process.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California (Davis, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions - same one for everyone.  Students with no qualifications interview other students and ask generic questions from a piece of paper that was obviously scribbled right before the interview.
Interview Questions: Stupid questions like "Think of a time when you had to overcome a situation you thought you couldn't."

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California
Interview Descriptions: Awkward, the colleagues seemed tense as if they didn't want to work there.
Interview Questions: Why did you move in high school?

title: Events Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. Interview questions weren't tricky at all. The interviewers were friendly so I advise you just relax and answer the questions as best as you can. Keep it professional of course.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time you disagreed with a group member or teammate?

Can you lift 30 lbs?

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: call and then in person, interviewed by three physicians, very polite and professional, asked about the work experience related to job , asked about the ways to conduct the position
Interview Questions: how to manage the certain condition, how to avoid stress in work,....., expectations at the position,

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple and professional. The interview consisted of two on site interviews. The first interview was with the Hiring Manager and another Business Analyst. It consisted of standard Business Analysis questions about requirement gathering, documentation and task prioritization. Was presented with various scenarios, technical as well as professional, to solve. The second interview was with the department's Sr. Director. Standard HR interview with questions ranging from "Why is this a good position for you?" to "What will you bring to this position?". I was also required to provide with some work samples as well as TWO professional references.
Interview Questions: What would be your approach to a situation for with you require some feedback and you do not have your Manager to guide you?

title: Consulting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: They went through a series of questions.
Interview Questions: set up a program

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers are nice.
Interview Questions: How do you defined job satisfaction

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very well organized. Interview set up by phone with a detailed email - interview committee, location and interview format. Pleasant experience. I was taken aback at the number of empty cubicles and storage rooms. Still ramping up from a reorganization. Did not hear back after interview although followup was offered after the interview. Difficult to say what the office is like. Work culture I believe is - do more work with less - less resources and less time.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were in charge and the outcome was not as expected.
